intro: Amoora poulocondorensis, commonly known as the Pulo Condore Amoora, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its attractive, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
